isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - VEHICLE FEATURES - Optional Features

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Control
svcsubproc.para: Cruise Control regulates vehicle speed using automotive style On/Off, Set/Coast Resume/Accel switches. Speed control is disabled when the service brakes are applied, the clutch pedal is depressed, or an automatic transmission is placed in neutral. The accelerator pedal can be used to increase speed from the selected cruise speed.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Speed Control for PTO
svcsubproc.para: DT 466E and INTERNATIONAL® 530E engines are compatible with both stationary and mobile PTO applications. Remote and in-cab throttle controls are available. Also, throttle control can be used as an electronic hand throttle during warm up procedures or idle operation during cold weather.

svcsubproc.title: Road Speed Limiting/Governor
svcsubproc.para: The Road Speed Limiting/Governor limits speed to maximum vehicle speed programmed by the customer.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Shutdown System
svcsubproc.para: The engine warning system is included with the engine shutdown system. The engine shutdown system shuts down the engine after 30 seconds of operation past critical threshold values for coolant temperature or oil pressure, or both.

svcsubproc.title: Idle Shutdown (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: Idle Shutdown provides automatic engine shutdown after idle time exceeds 2 to 120 minutes. The owner or operator can program extended idle time for maximum or minimum intake air temperatures. If Idle shutdown is triggered, the ECM will flash the Oil / Water light, sound the buzzer for 30 seconds, and set a DTC code before engine shutdown. When Idle Shutdown is selected, Cold Ambient Protection is automatically disabled.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Pressure Governor (EPG)
svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Pressure Governor can be used on special trucks equipped with hydraulic pumps when output pressure is controlled by adjusting engine rpm (i.e. fire trucks). Body builder connections are provided and the ECM can be programmed for this purpose on request. This feature can be programmed to fit the needs of the operator. Engine rpm, ramp rate, and Electronic Pressure Governor gain adjustments are among the available variables.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Fan (control)
svcsubproc.para: Engine Fan control allows the ECM to regulate engagement and disengagement of the engine fan depending on Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) or air conditioning demand. The ECM can also be programmed to use engine fan control to retard engine speed.

svcsubproc.title: Electronically Controlled Radiator Shutters
svcsubproc.para: Radiator shutters are controlled by the ECM to maintain correct engine coolant temperature during cold weather. Shutters improve the performance of the engine and improve the operation of the cab heater and the windshield defroster. Fuel mileage can also be increased.
